I Wanna Rock'n'Roll All Night\n", '"I Wanna Rock" is the third official single from American rapper, Snoop Dogg\'s tenth studio album, "Malice n Wonderland". It was released digitally on iTunes on November 17, 2009, after the second single "That\'s Tha Homie". The song was produced by Scoop DeVille and mixed by Dr. Dre, and Snoop Dogg released it on a mixtape titled "I Wanna Rock" on November 23. The song was confirmed by BBC Radio 1 to be released in the UK on March 15, 2010 but is now listed as "Coming Soon".\n', 'The song was written by Snoop Dogg, Wiz Khalifa and produced by KJ Conteh. The song contains a sample of "I Wanna Rock" by Luther Campbell from his album "I Got Shit on My Mind".\n', 'BULLET::::9. "All I Wanna Do Is Rock" (Wilson)\n', 'BULLET::::- DJ Jazzy Jeff & the Fresh Prince sampled "All Night Long" on the track "I Wanna Rock" from their 1993 final studio album "Code Red".\n', '"Just Wanna Rock N\' Roll" is a song written by Rodney Clawson and Chris Tompkins, and recorded by American country music artist Rodney Atkins. It was released in June 2012 as the third single from his album "Take a Back Road." On the Hot Country Songs chart, the song peaked at No. 39. It also peaked at No. 31 on the Country Airplay chart.\n']

**Expert 1: Rock Music Historian**
"I want to clarify that the song 'I Wanna Rock 'n' Roll All Night' is often mistakenly attributed to various artists. The correct artist is the iconic rock band KISS. **Expert 2: Musicologist**
"While Expert 1 is correct about KISS, it's important to note that there is a common confusion with the song 'I Wanna Rock' by Twisted Sister, which was released in 1984. "I'd like to bring attention to the modern interpretations of the phrase 'I Wanna Rock.' "Indeed, the phrase 'I Wanna Rock' has become a cultural touchstone, representing a desire for freedom and self-expression. However, the phrase has been adapted and reinterpreted in various musical contexts, notably by Twisted Sister and Snoop Dogg, showcasing its versatility and enduring appeal. This dialogue illustrates how music evolves over time, with phrases and themes resonating across genres and generations, enriching our understanding of cultural expressions in music.

In summary, while KISS's original song remains a cornerstone of rock, the broader implications of the phrase 'I Wanna Rock' reflect a cultural phenomenon that continues to inspire artists across different musical landscapes. This multifaceted perspective enhances our appreciation of the song's legacy and its relevance in contemporary music discourse.

passages:
BULLET::::8. "I Wanna Rock And Roll All Night"(Kiss (band))
"I Wanna Rock" is a song written and composed by Dee Snider and performed by his band Twisted Sister. It was released on the 1984 album "Stay Hungry".

I Wanna Rock (Snoop Dogg song)
BULLET::::9. I Wanna Rock'n'Roll All Night
"I Wanna Rock" is the third official single from American rapper, Snoop Dogg's tenth studio album, "Malice n Wonderland". It was released digitally on iTunes on November 17, 2009, after the second single "That's Tha Homie". The song was produced by Scoop DeVille and mixed by Dr. Dre, and Snoop Dogg released it on a mixtape titled "I Wanna Rock" on November 23. The song was confirmed by BBC Radio 1 to be released in the UK on March 15, 2010 but is now listed as "Coming Soon".
The song was written by Snoop Dogg, Wiz Khalifa and produced by KJ Conteh. The song contains a sample of "I Wanna Rock" by Luther Campbell from his album "I Got Shit on My Mind".
BULLET::::9. "All I Wanna Do Is Rock" (Wilson)
BULLET::::- DJ Jazzy Jeff & the Fresh Prince sampled "All Night Long" on the track "I Wanna Rock" from their 1993 final studio album "Code Red".
"Just Wanna Rock N' Roll" is a song written by Rodney Clawson and Chris Tompkins, and recorded by American country music artist Rodney Atkins. It was released in June 2012 as the third single from his album "Take a Back Road." On the Hot Country Songs chart, the song peaked at No. 39. It also peaked at No. 31 on the Country Airplay chart.
